column4: Anyone? no one has any suggestions? Anytime I play a video with whatever player, if another application plays a sound I lose the audio to my video
and must restart the damn video
did you uninstall pulseaudio by mistake?
I'm of no help, try making a new user account and see if it happens to it too. If it doesn't, theres someting misconfigured in your account and you could just wipe out those settings files
run you video player from a terminal and see what it spits out. mPlayer would be best, it gives lots of output
https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-audio-dev/+archive/ppa    and then install the alsa modules for your kernel
It's a newer version of alsa
open synaptic, search for alsa-driver-modules    install the latest (not the backports) and then restart your computer
Yes, the one ending in -24 is newer than your kernel so don't install it
hooray! I guess you have some serious driver issues. You should probably file a bug report. uninstalling those modules will revert
or learn to write drivers, yep
did it work like this on the LiveCD or is this a new development?
if it used to work, you can probably fix it. if it's a driver bug, file a very detailed report and maybe someone will fix it
creative are evil with their drivers
